db:abstract.db:para: The QDomNodeList class is a list of QDomNode objects.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:listitem.db:para: QDomNodeList is part of XML Classes

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: Lists can be obtained by QDomDocument::elementsByTagName() and QDomNode::childNodes(). The Document Object Model (DOM) requires these lists to be "live": whenever you change the underlying document, the contents of the list will get updated.
You can get a particular node from the list with item(). The number of items in the list is returned by length().
For further information about the Document Object Model see Level 1 and Level 2 Core. For a more general introduction of the DOM implementation see the QDomDocument documentation.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QDomNodeList::~QDomNodeList()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the object and frees its resources.

db:section.db:title: QDomNode QDomNodeList::at(int index) const
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for Qt API consistency. It is equivalent to item().
If index is negative or if index >= length() then a null node is returned (i.e. a node for which QDomNode::isNull() returns true).

db:section.db:title: int QDomNodeList::count() const
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for Qt API consistency. It is equivalent to length().

db:section.db:title: bool QDomNodeList::isEmpty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the list contains no items; otherwise returns false. This function is provided for Qt API consistency.

db:section.db:title: QDomNode QDomNodeList::item(int index) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the node at position index.
If index is negative or if index >= length() then a null node is returned (i.e. a node for which QDomNode::isNull() returns true).

db:section.db:title: int QDomNodeList::length() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the number of nodes in the list.

db:section.db:title: int QDomNodeList::size() const
db:section.db:para: This function is provided for Qt API consistency. It is equivalent to length().

db:section.db:title: bool QDomNodeList::operator!=(const QDomNodeList &n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true the node list n and this node list are not equal; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QDomNodeList &QDomNodeList::operator=(const QDomNodeList &n)
db:section.db:para: Assigns n to this node list.

db:section.db:title: bool QDomNodeList::operator==(const QDomNodeList &n) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the node list n and this node list are equal; otherwise returns false.
